group_1.textLeft: Something like that happened while Alina-san@and Karin-san were in the hospital...
And... this picture was drawn at that time...?

group_1.textRight: Yeah, that it was.

group_1.textLeft: How did you come to find this picture, Professor...?

group_1.textRight: I happened to make the acquaintance
of a former nurse who worked at Satomi Medical Center.
When we chatted, it turned out the nurse was@in charge of Karin-kun and her friend.
And so, I asked how those two were doing.
Things fell into place... and that's how I found this drawing.
I asked the artist myself. Karin-kun.
And when I did, it turned out she kept it safe.
I implored her to let me borrow it for a little while,@you see,
as this would be another resource for@raising Magical Girl awareness.

group_1.textLeft: That's true... though it's a rather peculiar resource...

group_1.textRight: Here, take a look at the back.
Karin-kun requested I read the manga as well.
Yeah.

group_1.textLeft: I can't deny it... it is art in its own way...
It's a portrait drawing... isn't it?

group_1.textRight: Haha, I suppose so.
We have to look at it under the assumption it's a@"Magical Girl drawing",
but without that discernment, so to speak, it's...
A bundle of passion, I suppose?

group_1.textLeft: You could say that... it's utterly overwhelming...

group_1.textRight: Her use of color and her pen strokes@are certainly her own.
And on top of that, this drawing is just plain simple.
I find there's purity in just drawing a theme@to your heart's content.
And as such, it holds blatant power over its viewer@with its appeal.

group_1.textLeft: Yes, I do see what you mean...

group_1.textRight: That aside, though, according to Karin-kun,@this picture is...
Is apparently Tamaki Iroha-kun.
There's really nothing concrete, but by Karin-kun's@judgment,
it's most likely her... so she says.
Apparently she just went all-out in one sitting,@drawing after drawing.
There's more... look.
Apparently, whether from listening to Karin-kun's@stories
or relying on her own memories,
she drew a whole slew of Magical Girls.
And at the end of it all, she simply said "bored"@and dropped the whole thing right then and there.
Right...
And all of them are drawn on the back of@"Everyday Karin"...
Mm?

group_1.textLeft: I just... had an idea pop up in my head...!
